pros: Great experience and call volume! This place is truly what you make of it! Always an opportunity to be able to work as much as you want to!
cons: High call volume can take it out on the provider. However management doesn’t really care about how many calls the providers run as long as their numbers are good.

pros: Great people in the field, a couple good people in Administration.
cons: It's high school all over again. Beware, if you work hard, challenge the status quo, and outshine someone above you they will find the tiniest reason to write you up and once that happens they are ready to show you the door.

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) in Richmond, VA
pros: Only paid EMS-only 911 system in the metro Richmond area.
cons: Busy system/high call volume. Understaffed and overworked. Poorly managed. Can barely keep ambulances on the streets most days.

pros: Acuity of patient population in Richmond.
cons: Hourly pay, management, and call volume.

Unrealistic Expectations
Horrible training. I was supposed to come  in as Patient Account Analyst II. I received an informal training for approximately 3weeks. During that time i was assessed on the accounts i first worked on and wasn't given any type of feedback until 3weeks later which was below average. They allowed someone  sit with me for a week but i still wasn't assessed on what i was doing wrong. Only one person gave me valuable input. Overall the training was a complete joke. I was basically threatened to resign or be placed on a performance plan for a week and risk still being fired.

review_title: A true learning experience, not for the weak of heart.
pros:
Training and experience.
New ambulances with good equipment.
cons:
Management.
Still lost in the good ole boy system.
How or when you progress depends on who you are friends with.
Do not like medics with experience.

review_title: An ok stepping stone; a terrible work environment
pros: Good experience, good training and constant work.
cons: Work environment is toxic; management feels pitted against the field staff. Coworkers are hit or miss. You will be overworked, like it or not.

cons: Disparity in compensation, other than that, it's good1

job_title: PATIENT ACCOUNT ANALYST II in Richmond, VA
pros: People outside of Reimbursement department are fairly great, especially Julie Szala in HR, she is who you want to confide in and go to for advice.
cons: It's not about the quality of your work, it's all about politics.
